page.title: 01Llanddulas,past and present.
page.content: Our survey area is a mixture of hilly countryside,and built-up areas like Penmaenrhos and Llanddulas.It is also by the seaside.Important features are the A55 main road,the new Expressway, and the Llanddulas limestone quarries. The roads are important because this part of N.Wales is a tourist area. There are many holiday chalets and caravan sites here.The Hotel 70 Degrees is spectacular,on the edge of a cliff overlooking Colwyn Bay. The quarries are two huge holes in the local limestone,right by the road,with ships visiting 2 jetties for stones and gravel.Many Llanddulas people work in the quarries. Llanddulas village is very old,sit- uated in the valley of the River Dulas where it joins the sea.There is a large new estate,as many people have moved here for work and to retire.
